entry.title: Rate Limiting & Throttling
entry.summary:
Rate Limiting & Throttling: Managing API Requests
Introduction: Rate limiting and throttling are crucial mechanisms for managing the flow of requests to a system, especially APIs. They prevent overload and ensure fair access for all users. While often used interchangeably, they have subtle differences. Rate limiting defines a specific number of requests allowed within a given time window, while throttling adjusts the rate dynamically based on system load. Prerequisites: Implementing rate limiting and throttling requires careful consideration of: Request identification: Unique identifiers (IP addresses, API keys) are needed to track request rates. Time window: Defining the appropriate timeframe (e.g., per second, minute, hour) for counting requests. Limit enforcement: Choosing a mechaniâ€¦

entry.title: What is pipelining in microprocessor?
entry.summary:
Pipelining is a technique used in microprocessors(what is microprocessor?) to increase instruction throughput â€” the number of instructions that can be executed in a given amount of time â€” by overlapping the execution of multiple instructions.
Analogy: Assembly Line Instead of building one car at a time from start to finish, Different stations (like engine fitting, painting, testing) work simultaneously on different cars. Likewise, in pipelining: Different stages of instruction execution are processed in parallel. Basic Pipeline Stages
Example: Without vs With Pipelining
In pipelining, a new instruction enters the pipeline every clock cycle, so multiple instructions are being processed at once â€” each in a different stage. Advantages of Pipelining Higher throughput Better CPU performance Efficient use of CPU resources Limitations / Hazards
Solutions include: Forwarding, stalling, and branch prediction techniques. Used In: 8086 (basic pipelining: Fetch + Execute) Modern processors (ARM, x86) with deep pipelines (10+ stages) Super-scalar and out-of-order execution

entry.title: Peeking Under the Hood: How to List Your npm Packages
entry.summary: As developers, we spend a lot of time installing packages. Whether it's a new framework, a handy utility, or a build tool, npm install is a command we type almost subconsciously. But how often do we stop to consider what's actually installed on our system or within our projects? Knowing how to list your npm packages is more than just curiosity; it's a fundamental skill for debugging, understanding project dependencies, and maintaining a healthy development environment. Let's dive into the essential commands you need to master. Before we get to the "how," let's quickly touch on the "why": Debugging: Is your build failing? A conflicting package version might be the culprit. Listing packages helps you identify what's actually installed. Auditing: Want to check if a specific package (or an outâ€¦

entry.title: Why WT3 is the Future of AI Agents? Trustlessness is Key
entry.summary:
AI in crypto has become the new normal. Every dApp tries to adopt some form of AI applicability to become cutting-edge and capture the imagination and attention of the public. DeFi has, as a result, evolved to DeFAI where AI agents have started taking center stage more and more. But what about trust while on-chain trading? Will it be verifiable? Oasis has the solution in WT3.
The BTS Tech Stack
The tech stack working behind the scenes to set up WT3 is singularly powered up. Oasis Sapphire is the base for on-chain confidentiality, and the ROFL (runtime off-chain logic) framework is the component enabling computations that can be verified without on-chain dependency. This also benefits in ensuring decentralized key management.
Predictoor trading signals are integral to incorporate accurâ€¦

Edition #210 - May 2025
Welcome to issue #210 of the AWS open source newsletter, the newsletter where I try and provide you the best open source on AWS content. entry.title: How AI Agents Are Transforming the Future of E-Commerce Automation
entry.summary: In todayâ€™s digitally driven economy, businesses are under constant pressure to meet growing customer expectations while staying efficient and competitive. One breakthrough technology reshaping the e-commerce landscape is the rise of AI agentsâ€”autonomous systems capable of managing complex tasks without human intervention. These intelligent agents are powering a new wave of automation, enhancing customer experiences, boosting operational efficiency, and streamlining logistics across the board. Unlike traditional tools that rely heavily on manual input and supervision, AI agents think, learn, and act independently. They adapt in real time, making smarter decisions that save businesses both time and money. 1. Intelligent Customer Interaction 2. Real-Time Inventory Management 3. Streamlined Order Fulfillment 4. Smart Pricing Strategies 5. Personalized Product Recommendations Advanced Chatbots with Decision-Making Skills AI-Powered Virtual Store Managers Visual Search Capabilities Fraud Detection and Risk Mitigation Cost Efficiency Scalable Growth Consistent Service Delivery Real-Time Decision-Making Adapting to Evolving Consumer Behavior Managing Seasonal Traffic Peaks Expanding Globally with Ease AI agents arenâ€™t just enhancing e-commerceâ€”theyâ€™re redefining it. By bringing automation, intelligence, and real-time adaptability to the forefront, theyâ€™re helping businesses deliver top-tier service while reducing operational burdens. For brands aiming to thrive in an increasingly competitive digital market, adopting AI-powered solutions is no longer optionalâ€”itâ€™s essential. At Destinova AI Labs, weâ€™re leading this transformation with cutting-edge AI agents tailored specifically for e-commerce. Our mission is to equip businesses with the tools they need to scale smarter, serve better, and succeed faster.

entry.title: Building Resilient Hybrid Cloud Architectures
entry.summary:
"Cloud or on-prem? Why not both?" Thatâ€™s what I saidâ€¦ right before I nearly set my career on fire. It started innocently enough: our CTO wanted the speed and flexibility of the cloud but couldnâ€™t part with our on-prem infrastructure â€” you know, the one weâ€™d sunk years (and a criminal amount of money) into. â€œWeâ€™ll build a hybrid cloud,â€ they said.
â€œItâ€™ll be simple,â€ they said. It wasnâ€™t. But it was worth it. If youâ€™re venturing into hybrid cloud territory and want to build something resilient â€” not just duct-taped together with hope and curl scripts â€” let me walk you through the minefield. Iâ€™ve got scars, stories, and surprisingly, a working solution. It lets you combine the control of on-premises systems with the agility and scalability of cloud platforms. But unlike a mullet, it can actuâ€¦
